intro: Stussenia, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Bolivia and Peru. The plants typically grow in high-altitude environments, where they thrive in cool, moist conditions. Stussenia species are characterized by their evergreen leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. These plants are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to harsh, alpine climates.
